settings.title: About
settings.description_text:
We're building a better spice trade, equitably and deliciously.

We source India's freshest, heirloom, and single-origin spices, directly from our partner farms to bring you next level flavor and fragrance!

settings.title: Newsletter
settings.newsletter_text:
We write a pretty great newsletter.

Seasonal reading lists, highly cookable recipes, feelings-filled harvest reports, and lots more.

Plus, we hella respect your privacy.

settings.title: Let's be email friends?
settings.exit_intent_body:
We write a pretty great newsletter.

First dibs on the latest spice harvests, seasonal reading lists, highly cookable recipes, and very emotional harvest reports! We do it all! 

Plus, we hella respect your privacy.

settings.title: Fresh
settings.subtitle: Guaranteed same-year harvest, milled every 3 months
settings.paragraph: versus powders that can be up to five years old, still sitting on a grocery store shelf. Our turmeric has a floral fragrance due to its freshness.

settings.title: Potent
settings.subtitle: 100% pure heirloom variety
settings.paragraph: versus conventional turmeric, made of a blend of multiple low-quality varieties. ½ tsp of our turmeric equals 1 tsp of conventional turmeric in flavor and strength.

settings.title: Sustainable
settings.subtitle: Organically farmed
settings.paragraph: versus industrial spice farming sprayed with chemicals, and grown for yield + storability. Our turmeric is grown for the best flavor + fragrance, and reverses soil depletion.

settings.title: Equitable
settings.subtitle: Directly traded and farmers paid up to 6x the commodity price
settings.paragraph: versus spices passed through several traders in an unjust supply chain before arriving to the consumer. Traditional spice trading pays farmers 2% or less of revenue.

settings.yellow-text:
The original intent of colonial conquest of the Indian subcontinent was a desire for domination of the spice trade.

In late 2016, 600+ years later, as a young woman born and raised in postcolonial Mumbai, working at the intersection of food and culture, I was slowly discovering that not much about that system had changed.

Farmers made no money, spices changed hands upwards of 10 times between farmer and consumer, and the final spice on the shelf was usually an old, dusty, and flavorless shadow of what it once was.
settings.orange-text:
Ten wild months that included a one way ticket back to India, intense research, 40+ farm visits, endless un-answered phone calls, wild motorbike rides through farmland, and a lot of processing of doubts and fears later, Diaspora Co. was founded in late 2017 to create a radically new, and equitable vision of the spice trade, decolonizing a commodity back into a seasonal crop, and a broken system into an equal exchange.

Beyond highlighting gorgeous, indigenous spice varieties, it's also about creating a business for us, by us. Complicating and deepening what “Made in India” means, and how we tell our own stories of freedom, struggle, and diaspora through food.
settings.pink-text:
Today, we work in close partnership with the Indian Council of Agricultural Research to identify and provide ongoing support to our partner farmers, all of whom are on the cutting edge of regenerative, and sustainable agriculture.

Mr. Chacko in Kerala developed his own heirloom cardamom variety! Mr. Kasaraneni in Andhra Pradesh taught himself organic farming via Youtube and WhatsApp, the first in his entire village to go chemical-free! Mr. Sakariya grows indescribably fruity coriander on a guava and sitaphal orchard. Our partner farmers are our heroes.

As of 2021 we're proud of work with 12 farmers and 320+ farm workers across 6 states. We pay our farm partners an average 6x more than the commodity price, and by the end of this year we aim to provide health insurance to every single farm worker that is part of our rapidly growing supply chain.

- Sana Javeri Kadri, Founder & CEO

settings.maintext:
We are here to put money, equity and power into the hands of Indian farmers, and to disrupt and decolonize an outdated commodity spice trading system.
What do we mean by decolonization? We mean creating a spice trade that redistributes power away from solely the trader and instead, empowers its farmers, its laborers and the earth.
settings.bottomtextleft: In cutting out all middle men, we hugely increase the amount of money we can pay our partner farms. It means we are able to work with much smaller farms who in a traditional model would have lacked the capital or resources to export or scale. Our focus is on flavor, sustainability and heirloom seed, so if a farmer matches those criteria, they can rest assured that they will have a long term partner in us.
settings.bottomtextright: In the commodity trading model several farmers crops are mixed together at every stage. Quality is assessed based on aesthetics (color and size) versus how it was grown, which seeds it was grown from, and how it tastes or smells. It means that the farmer has no agency or control over the price they receive, or the quality of the final product. We’re here to say that that system is no longer good enough- we all deserve better.

settings.page_text: We've opened up our Trio to your creative combo-making genius. Shipped in our super cute boxes - perfect for gifting!
We partnered with Tiipoi to bring you an heirloom pairing of our single origin Indian spices in an artisanal brass dabba that will last for generations to come!
Save $2.50 when you build your own trio. Shipped in our super cute boxes - perfect for gifting!
We partnered with Tiipoi to bring you an heirloom pairing of our single origin Indian spices in an hand-spun brass dabba that will last for generations to come!

settings.spice_description: Grown by the Kasaraneni family amidst marigolds, bananas, and black rice on the 4th generation farm. Whilst Mr. Prabhu Kasaraneni's family has been farming for three generations, he is a self taught organic farmer who began growing heirloom Pragati turmeric in 2015, with assistance from the Indian Institute of Spices Research.

Grown on the Parameswaran family farm, where Parameswaran and his son Akash have been organically farming pepper for over 35 years, amidst passion fruit, tigers (no, really!), and jackfruits. Their Aranya pepper is vine ripened, hand harvested with utmost care, and is unreasonably flavorful.

Grown by the Chacko family amidst black pepper, coffee, and flowers on their estate turned wild food forest! As a pioneer in the natural farming movement, Mr. Chacko is one of the only farmers that has been able to domesticate a wild cardamom variety that thrives without pesticides, and is still beautifully aromatic!

Grown on the Sakariya family farm amidst custard apples, guavas, and heirloom wheat, our beautiful Nandini coriander is named after the Sakariya family's beloved cow, the undisputed matriarch of their regenerative farm. It's a variety that Dharmesh, a third generation farmer and natural farming expert has keenly developed for its incredible fragrance and vibrant coloring.

Grown on Prahlad Ramji's small family farm in Inana, Rajasthan, this is his first truly organic harvest, as a self taught and passionate natural farmer. His farm is on the edge of the Thar Desert, making it the perfect scorching, arid climate for deeply flavorful cumin.

Grown by Harish Manoj Kumar & Karthikeyan Palaniswamy on their family estate at the base of the Western Ghats alongside their award-winningAnamalai Cacao. Your nutmeg is fully tree ripened for maximum flavor and oil content, which keeps it aromatic in your kitchen for longer! Manoj is a regenerative farmer and has converted the entire estate to be 100% chemical free since 2012, a change that has caused the nutmeg trees with their shallow root systems to really flourish and transform as the soil has gotten more and more nourishment.

Grown by Harish Manoj Kumar & Karthikeyan Palaniswamy on their family estate at the base of the Western Ghats alongside their award-winningAnamalai Cacao. Your nutmeg is fully tree ripened for maximum flavor and oil content, which keeps it aromatic in your kitchen for longer! Manoj is a regenerative farmer and has converted the entire estate to be 100% chemical free since 2012, a change that has caused the nutmeg trees with their shallow root systems to really flourish and transform as the soil has gotten more and more nourishment.

Grown by Zeinorin Angkang and her small collective of neighbors turned organic farmers in the hills of Ukhrul, Manipur alongside indigenous soybeans, rice and yams. These fiery chillies are smoked on bamboo mats over a wood fire to give them their intoxicating fruity, smoky fragrance. Zeinorin is a skilled farmer, business woman and a proud member of the Tangkhul tribe which is why we call these chillies by their Tangkhul name of Sivathei!

Proudly grown by a cooperative of farmers in Sirarakhong and sourced for us by our friends Zeinorin & Alan of Hillwild. Legend has it that the villagers' ancestors found these exquisitely long, vibrant chillies growing in the wild on a hunting trip that they then brought home and have made a part of their daily cuisine ever since. Many nearby villages have tried to grow the Sirarakhong Hathei chillies, but something about the terroir of Sirarakhong produces the very best of the best!

Grown by the Farukh family on their ancestral land in Pulwana in the Kashmir valley from seed that has been passed down for generations, alongside purple stripe heirloom garlic. This is true Kashmiri mirch - hot as ever, and with deep color and heat that iconic Kashmiri dishes like our farm partner Bashir Ahmed's famous rogan josht is known for.

Grown in the forests of Kandy alongside wild cinnamon, nutmeg, and the biggest jackfruits you have ever seen. These plump, oil-rich gems are hand-harvested and hand-sorted for us by our friends at Eko Land Produce, a community of organic farmers from the heart of Sri Lanka!

settings.flavors: Treacle ~ Lemongrass ~ Warm Bread ~ Hachiya Persimmon
settings.spice_description: Grown by a small group of organic farmers in the Jaintia hills alongside Lakadong turmeric and black sesame. This wildly strong, surprisingly tiny heirloom ginger variety (Makhir means small in Khasi!) is sourced for us by our friends at Zizira, a small team of Meghalaya locals dedicated to connecting Meghalayan farmers to better markets. Besides sheer potency, it's also more caramel-y and aromatic than any ginger you've ever tried!

Grown by husband & wife duo Dr. Elango & Dr. Susitra on their lush estate in the Kolli HIlls amidst cloves, nutmeg, and pepper. This is India's only USDA certified organic cardamom, a testament to the decades of investment and care that our doctor-farmer heroes have put in to make this high yielding Njallani variety thrive sans chemical inputs!

settings.text_body: Diaspora Co. was founded by 3rd gen Mumbai native, Sana Javeri Kadri in 2017 to build a more equitable and delicious spice trade that championed her heroes - Indian farmers leading the way on sustainable agriculture. We are a company as built for and by passionate home cooks, putting flavor at the tippy top of absolutely everything we do!

settings.product_description: So very proud to be partnering with a fellow desi woman led biz like One Stripe Chai Co. to reclaim the drink that started it all - the turmeric latte ft. our gorgeous Pragati Turmeric!
It wouldn't be an exaggeration to say that this might be our favorite hot sauce on earth. Made with our Pragati Turmeric, this hot sauce is Brooklyn, Barbados and Bombay rolled into one!
settings.button_text: Shop on Shaquanda Will Feed You

settings.product_description: Our friend Sonoko is a phenomenal Japanese cooking teacher, author and creator of the homemade curry brick that the NYT calls "the secret to Japanese comfort food on demand". The hardest part of which is procuring all the spices, so we did that for you!
We came up with this recipe over a year ago whilst trying to find delicious ways to showcase our turmeric. It's cheesy, earthy, salty goodness - and when popped in ghee (do it!), it's truly perfect.

settings.title: Collaborations
settings.description: We collaborate with BIPOC-led businesses on delicious food products that spotlight our spices and champion a new maker that we feel in community with!
